column5: A while ago I posted a link to a video on how to clean a pike. I had several people make comments that perhaps I should show what kind of knife I use, how to sharpen them, etc. Well, I've made an attempt at this and here's the link... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L-TKaFiE2Z8&feature=plcp
Well explained, thanks for sharing. Bill
Maybe use the knife to trim all that forearm hair.
Funny you should mention that. I'm thinking of doing a video on "Managing your bikini line using a fillet knife".
Maybe it's time to consider changing camps. Where is yours located?
Sorry Mark, I can't divulge the location and date of "Bikini Week at VBL"
IF you did ----- I'll bet the camp would be full ---- just sayin'
Thanks for a great video. I'm going to pick up a Chestnut Carbide Sharpener and give it a try.
Gord Love the video!!Gonna get one of the Chestnut sharpeners.I've got a hone like the one you had in the video It workls great!FC
A knife sharpener similar to the one in the video is available here:http://speedysharp.net/ I purchased mine in Canada (home) at the Canadian Tire Store. Regards, Snowball
